abstract: In 2002, a JPMorgan Chase banker named Charles E. LeCroy arrived in Birmingham, Alabama with a novel pitch to ease taxpayers’ burden. Some Wall Street wizardry, he said, could lighten their load.
lead_paragraph: In 2002, a JPMorgan Chase banker named Charles E. LeCroy arrived in Birmingham, Alabama with a novel pitch to ease taxpayers’ burden. Some Wall Street wizardry, he said, could lighten their load.

headline.main: High Finance Backfires on Alabama County
